statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Hartford 73, Maine 67
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- David Ruffin scored a career-high 24 points and Charles Ford went 5-of-6 from the free throw line in the final 39 seconds to lead Hartford to a 73-67 win over Maine Wednesday night. Ruffin also had five rebounds and led all players with four assists and five steals for the Hawks (6-10, 2-5 America East). Ford finished with nine points. Hartford led by 11 at the half and pushed the lead to 49-33 six minutes into the final stanza. The Hawks were up 65-41 when Maine (8-8, 3-4) went on a 13-2 run over the next 3:20 to cut the lead to three. Ernest Turner scored six points during the run for Maine and finished with a game-high 30 points. His layup with 47 seconds remaining dropped Hartford's lead to 67-64. Hartford's Aaron Cook then turned the ball over. Turner gave up an open shot from the outside and drove to the basket, but missed. Bo Taylor got the rebound for the Hawks and gave it to Ford, who was fouled three times in the final seconds and iced the game with free throws. Brian Glowiak scored 11 points and Cook added 10 for Hartford. Kevin Reed had 16 points and 11 rebounds for Maine, while Mark Flavin chipped in 14 points for the Black Bears.
